intro: Gymnopsis costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican gymnopsis, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Gymnopsis costaricensis is known for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine by local communities.
